paper_abstract: A reliable atmospheric remote-sensing monitor uses physical or statistical models for which the parameters must be retrieved quantitatively. However, such retrieval is data-intensive. High-resolution, wide-range, and long-duration observations produce several terabytes of data each day. Processing such massive volumes of data into scientific aerosol products involves addressing several computational problems. Processing Level 1B data for Level 2 aerosol products for a single day requires 13 Gbytes total to achieve full coverage of China's main land surface.
paper_title: Quantitative retrieval of geophysical parameters using satellite data
